intro: Pseudotenanthera, commonly known as the false tenanthera, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of a few species, primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants are characterized by their showy, often brightly colored flowers, which are typically borne in clusters. They have palmate leaves with lobed or entire margins, and their stems are usually hairy. Pseudotenanthera species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their striking floral display.
